title: Setka tells SA Treasurer 'take a big jump'
text:
Construction union leader John Setka has told South Australian Treasurer Rob Lucas "to take a big jump'' for referring to his union as a "cancer" and rejecting strict new safety requirements on building sites.

The controversial Victorian branch secretary made the comments at a rally in Adelaide on Wednesday where hundreds of building workers protested on the steps of Parliament House against the Liberal state government for not bringing in industrial manslaughter laws.

CFMEU Victorian secretary John Setka kept a low profile at the rally in Adelaide on Wednesday. AAP

Mr Setka was in Adelaide as part of the CFMEU's biennial national conference. He made the comments 15 minutes before resigning from the Labor party.

"Rob Lucas ought to take a big jump and have a good look at himself, to be honest,'' Mr Setka said at the rally.

The SA Treasurer had earlier accused Mr Setka of wanting to bring his brand of militancy to the state and said "we don't want the cancer in work sites in the eastern states infecting the work sites of South Australia". He alleged the CFMEU was using workplace deaths as "an excuse" to hold a protest as a political stunt.
description: The construction union leader has reacted angrily to Rob Lucas for referring to his union as a "cancer" and rejecting strict new safety requirements on building sites.
